docs.title: Welcome to Kubernetes Notes.
docs.text: For full documentation visit Kubernetes Documentation Page.

docs.title: List of Contents
docs.text: 1. Quick Guide

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Kubernetes is an open-source platform designed to automate deploying, scaling, and operating application containers. It orchestrates containerized applications across a cluster of machines, providing tools for managing containerized applications.

docs.title: 1. Cluster
docs.text: A Kubernetes cluster consists of a set of nodes that run containerized applications. Each cluster has a master node and worker nodes.

docs.title: 2. Pod
docs.text: A Pod is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes. It can contain one or more containers that share the same network namespace and storage.

docs.title: 3. Deployment
docs.text: A Deployment manages a set of identical Pods, ensuring that the specified number of Pods are running and available.

docs.title: 4. Service
docs.text: A Service exposes a set of Pods as a network service. It provides load balancing and service discovery.

docs.title: 5. Namespace
docs.text: Namespaces provide a mechanism for isolating groups of resources within a single cluster.

docs.title: 1. kubectl version
docs.text:
Check the version of kubectl and the Kubernetes cluster.

kubectl version

docs.title: 2. kubectl get nodes
docs.text:
List all nodes in the cluster.

kubectl get nodes

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NAME          STATUS   ROLES    AGE   VERSION
node1          Ready    master   10d   v1.21.0
node2          Ready    <none>   10d   v1.21.0

docs.title: 3. kubectl get pods
docs.text:
List all Pods in the current namespace.

kubectl get pods

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
NAME                     READY   STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
nginx-deployment-7fb8d6b9b-8qj7g   1/1     Running   0          5m

docs.title: 4. kubectl create
docs.text:
Create a resource from a file or from stdin.

kubectl create -f resource.yaml

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Create a Pod from a YAML file:

kubectl create -f pod.yaml

docs.title: 5. kubectl apply
docs.text:
Apply a configuration change to a resource.

kubectl apply -f resource.yaml

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Update a Deployment with a new configuration:

kubectl apply -f deployment.yaml

docs.title: 6. kubectl delete
docs.text:
Delete a resource.

kubectl delete -f resource.yaml

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Delete a Pod:

kubectl delete pod nginx-deployment-7fb8d6b9b-8qj7g

docs.title: 7. kubectl describe
docs.text:
Show detailed information about a resource.

kubectl describe pod pod_name

docs.title: Example
docs.text: kubectl describe pod nginx-deployment-7fb8d6b9b-8qj7g

docs.title: 8. kubectl logs
docs.text:
Print the logs for a container in a Pod.

kubectl logs pod_name

docs.title: Example
docs.text: kubectl logs nginx-deployment-7fb8d6b9b-8qj7g

docs.title: Pod Definition
docs.text:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: my-pod
spec:
  containers:
  - name: my-container
    image: nginx
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80

docs.title: Deployment Definition
docs.text:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80

docs.title: Service Definition
docs.text:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: nginx-service
spec:
  selector:
    app: nginx
  ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      port: 80
      targetPort: 80
  type: LoadBalancer

docs.title: Namespaces
docs.text: Namespaces help you organize resources in a cluster.

docs.title: Create a Namespace
docs.text: kubectl create namespace my-namespace

docs.title: List Namespaces
docs.text: kubectl get namespaces

docs.title: Use a Namespace
docs.text: kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=my-namespace

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: This tutorial introduces fundamental Kubernetes concepts and commands. Kubernetes simplifies container orchestration and management, making it easier to deploy and scale applications. For more detailed information, refer to the official Kubernetes documentation.
